Fund Overview
SBI Large Cap Fund aims to provide investors with opportunities for long-term growth in capital through an active management of investments in a diversified basket of large cap equity
The fund invests a minimum of 80% in large cap stocks*. Generally, Large cap stocks are well established companies having good brand equity and are possibly market leaders in their industries
SBI Large Cap Fund has the flexibility to invest up to 20% in equities other than large caps or debt and/or money market instruments
The fund follows a blend of growth and value style of investing with a combination of top down and bottom-up investment strategy for stock selection across sectors
*Large Cap Stocks are – 1st -100th company in terms of full market capitalization.
Mr. Saurabh Pant -
Saurabh Pant has over 16 years experience in capital markets. He joined SBI Funds Management Limited as a research analyst and currently manages equity funds. Saurabh is a Commerce graduate and holds a Master'sDegree in Business Economics from the University of Delhi.

FAQ Section
How to Invest in SBI Large Cap Fund (Formerly known as SBI Bluechip Fund)?
> Log in to the website.
> Choose between Lumpsum or Systematic Investment Plan (SIP).
> Choose your bank and preferred payment method.
> An OTP will be sent to your registered email ID and mobile number.
> Your transaction will be processed after OTP verification.
What is the current NAV of SBI Large Cap Fund (Formerly known as SBI Bluechip Fund)?
Latest closing NAV as on 14 Nov, 2025 for SBI Large Cap Fund (Formerly known as SBI Bluechip Fund) - Regular Plan - Growth is Rs. 94.9866
What is the AUM of SBI Large Cap Fund (Formerly known as SBI Bluechip Fund)?
AUM of SBI Large Cap Fund (Formerly known as SBI Bluechip Fund) is 54705.44 Cr.
What is the Riskometer level of SBI Large Cap Fund (Formerly known as SBI Bluechip Fund)?
SBI Large Cap Fund (Formerly known as SBI Bluechip Fund) is rated as a VERY HIGH. Benchmark Riskometer for this fund is S&P BSE 100 Index.
What are the top holdings of SBI Large Cap Fund (Formerly known as SBI Bluechip Fund)?
Top Holdings for the fund as per percentage of amount invested is as follows:
> RELIANCE INDUSTRIES LTD. : 7.88 %
> HDFC BANK LTD. : 7.35 %
> ICICI BANK LTD. : 7.13 %
> LARSEN & TOUBRO LTD. : 5.45 %
> INFOSYS LTD. : 3.96 %
> EICHER MOTORS LTD. : 3.95 %
Is there any lock-in period for SBI Large Cap Fund (Formerly known as SBI Bluechip Fund)?
No lock-in period is applicable for this fund.
What is the expense ratio of SBI Large Cap Fund (Formerly known as SBI Bluechip Fund)?
Expense ratio for Regular scheme is 1.48% as on 31 Oct 2025 and Expense Ratio for Direct Scheme is 0.81% as on 31 Oct 2025
How can I redeem my investments in SBI Large Cap Fund (Formerly known as SBI Bluechip Fund)?
> Login to your account.
> In the Dashboard, go to the Portfolio Snapshot section and click on Transact > Redeem.
> Enter the Amount/Units you wish to redeem.
> An OTP will be sent to your registered email ID/mobile number.
> After OTP verification, your redemption will be processed in 3 business working days.
What are the top sectors SBI Large Cap Fund (Formerly known as SBI Bluechip Fund) has invested in?
Sector Allocations for as per percentage of amount invested is as follows:
> FINANCIAL SERVICES : 30.57 %
> OIL, GAS & CONSUMABLE FUELS : 8.85 %
> AUTOMOBILE AND AUTO COMPONENTS : 8.54 %
> FAST MOVING CONSUMER GOODS : 6.7 %
> HEALTHCARE : 5.95 %
> INFORMATION TECHNOLOGY : 5.65 %
Who manages the SBI Large Cap Fund (Formerly known as SBI Bluechip Fund)?
The Fund manager for this fund is:
> Mr. Saurabh Pant since April 2024
What is the minimum investment in SBI Large Cap Fund (Formerly known as SBI Bluechip Fund)?
Minimum Lumpsum Amount applicable for this fund is Rs. 5000 in multiples of 1.
Minimum Additional Lumpsum Amount applicable for this fund is Rs. 1000 in multiples of 1.

Understand terms
Expense ratio
A fee payable to a mutual fund house for managing your mutual fund investments. It is the total percentage of a company’s fund assets used for administrative, management, advertising, and other expenses.
Tax
A percentage of your capital gains payable to the government upon exiting  your mutual fund investments. Taxation is categorized as long-term capital gains (LTCG) and short-term capital gains (STCG) depending on your holding period and the type of fund.
Exit load
A fee payable to a mutual fund house for exiting a fund (fully or partially) before the completion of a specified period from the date of investment.
Stamp duty
A form of tax payable for the purchase or sale of an asset or security.

FAQs
How to Invest in SBI Large & Midcap Fund Direct Plan Growth?
You can easily invest in SBI Large & Midcap Fund Direct Plan Growth in a hassle-free manner on Groww. The
process is extremely simple, quick and completely paperless. Invest in a few minutes with the following steps:
Log on to your Groww account
Search for SBI Large & Midcap Fund Direct Plan Growth from the search box
In order to invest, you will have to complete all the KYC formalities which are completely online and paperless
and take a few minutes to complete
Once you are done with that, you can start investing in SBI Large & Midcap Fund Direct Plan Growth as SIP or lumpsum as per your
investment objective and risk tolerance
What kind of returns does SBI Large & Midcap Fund Direct Plan Growth provide?
The SBI Large & Midcap Fund Direct Plan Growth has been there from 01 Jan 2013 and the average annual returns provided by this fund is 11.98% since its inception.
How much expense ratio is charged by SBI Large & Midcap Fund Direct Plan Growth?
The term
Expense Ratio
used for SBI Large & Midcap Fund Direct Plan Growth or any other mutual fund is the annual
charges one needs to pay to the Mutual Fund company for managing your investments in that fund.
The Expense Ratio of SBI Large & Midcap Fund Direct Plan Growth is 0.78% as of 17 Nov 2025...
What is the AUM of SBI Large & Midcap Fund Direct Plan Growth?
The AUM, short for
Assets Under Management
of SBI Large & Midcap Fund Direct Plan Growth is ₹35,514.42Cr as of 17 Nov 2025.
How to Redeem SBI Large & Midcap Fund Direct Plan Growth?
If you want to sell your SBI Large & Midcap Fund Direct Plan Growth holdings, go to your holding on the app or
web and simply click on it. You will get two options - redeem & invest more; click on redeem and enter your
desired amount or if you wish to redeem the entire holding amount then select the 'redeem all' checkbox.
Can I invest in SIP and Lump Sum of SBI Large & Midcap Fund Direct Plan Growth?
You can select either
SIP
or
Lumpsum
investment of SBI Large & Midcap Fund Direct Plan Growth based on
your investment objective and risk tolerance.
What is the NAV of SBI Large & Midcap Fund Direct Plan Growth?
The NAV of SBI Large & Midcap Fund Direct Plan Growth is ₹704.73 as of 14 Nov 2025.
What is the PE and PB ratio of SBI Large & Midcap Fund Direct Plan Growth?
The
PE ratio
ratio of SBI Large & Midcap Fund Direct Plan Growth is determined by dividing the market price by
its earnings per share and the
PB ratio
of the same is evaluated by dividing the stock price per share by its book value
per share (BVPS).

Fund Overview
To provide investors with opportunities for long term growth in capital from a diversified portfolio of equity and equity related instruments across market capitalization. However, there can be no assurance that the investment objective of the Scheme will be realized.
The scheme will follow a bottom-up approach to stock-picking and choose companies across sectors The scheme will invest in diversified portfolio of stocks across market capitalization.
Large Cap Stocks – 1st -100th company in terms of full market capitalization. Mid Cap:101st to 250th company in terms of full market capitalization. Small Cap: 251st company onwards in
terms of full market capitalization. The exposure across these stocks will be in line with limits/classification defined by AMFI/SEBI from time to time
Mr. R Srinivasan -
R Srinivasan has over 30 years’ rich experience in the financial services space. He has been associated with SBI Funds Management Limited since 2009 and as CIO – Equity directly manages a number of funds. He was formerly the Head of Equity. Srinivasan is a postgraduate in Commerce and has done his MFM from the University of Mumbai.

Notes:
Different plans shall have different expense structure. In case of return calculated the IDCW option, it is assumed that dividend declared under the schemes have been reinvested at the prevailing NAV
Past performance may or may not be sustained in future and same may not necessarily provide the basis for comparison with other investment
Load is not considered for computation of returns
Period for which scheme’s performance has been provided is computed basis last day of the month-end preceding the date of advertisement. In case, the start/end date of the concerned period is a non-business day, the NAV of the previous date is considered for computation of returns
The data of the last working day has been considered for the calculation of performance
Wherever TRI data since inception for benchmarks is not available, benchmark performance is calculated using composite of CAGR and TRI values of the benchmark
The performance of the schemes is benchmarked to the Total Return variant of the Index

Understand terms
Expense ratio
A fee payable to a mutual fund house for managing your mutual fund investments. It is the total percentage of a company’s fund assets used for administrative, management, advertising, and other expenses.
Tax
A percentage of your capital gains payable to the government upon exiting  your mutual fund investments. Taxation is categorized as long-term capital gains (LTCG) and short-term capital gains (STCG) depending on your holding period and the type of fund.
Exit load
A fee payable to a mutual fund house for exiting a fund (fully or partially) before the completion of a specified period from the date of investment.
Stamp duty
A form of tax payable for the purchase or sale of an asset or security.

Exit load

If you redeem within one year, returns are taxed at 20%. If you redeem after one year, returns exceeding Rs 1.25 lakh in a financial year are taxed at 12.5%.

SBI Multicap Fund Direct Growth is a Equity Mutual Fund Scheme launched by SBI Mutual Fund.     This scheme was made available to investors on 29
SBI Multicap Fund Direct Growth is a Equity Mutual Fund Scheme launched by SBI Mutual Fund.     This scheme was made available to investors on 29 Jun 1987.     Rama Iyer Srinivasan is the Current Fund Manager of SBI Multicap Fund Direct Growth fund.     The fund currently has an Asset Under Management(AUM) of ₹11,84,452 Cr and     the Latest NAV as of 14 Nov 2025 is ₹17.94.
The SBI Multicap Fund Direct Growth is rated Very High risk.     Minimum SIP Investment is set to ₹500.     Minimum Lumpsum Investment is ₹5,000.     Exit load of 0.25% if redeemed within 30 days and 0.10% if redeemed after 30 days but on or before 90 days.

FAQs
How to Invest in SBI Multicap Fund Direct Growth?
You can easily invest in SBI Multicap Fund Direct Growth in a hassle-free manner on Groww. The
process is extremely simple, quick and completely paperless. Invest in a few minutes with the following steps:
Log on to your Groww account
Search for SBI Multicap Fund Direct Growth from the search box
In order to invest, you will have to complete all the KYC formalities which are completely online and paperless
and take a few minutes to complete
Once you are done with that, you can start investing in SBI Multicap Fund Direct Growth as SIP or lumpsum as per your
investment objective and risk tolerance
What kind of returns does SBI Multicap Fund Direct Growth provide?
The SBI Multicap Fund Direct Growth has been there from 08 Mar 2022 and the average annual returns provided by this fund is 10.50% since its inception.
How much expense ratio is charged by SBI Multicap Fund Direct Growth?
The term
Expense Ratio
used for SBI Multicap Fund Direct Growth or any other mutual fund is the annual
charges one needs to pay to the Mutual Fund company for managing your investments in that fund.
The Expense Ratio of SBI Multicap Fund Direct Growth is 0.81% as of 17 Nov 2025...
What is the AUM of SBI Multicap Fund Direct Growth?
The AUM, short for
Assets Under Management
of SBI Multicap Fund Direct Growth is ₹23,986.25Cr as of 17 Nov 2025.
How to Redeem SBI Multicap Fund Direct Growth?
If you want to sell your SBI Multicap Fund Direct Growth holdings, go to your holding on the app or
web and simply click on it. You will get two options - redeem & invest more; click on redeem and enter your
desired amount or if you wish to redeem the entire holding amount then select the 'redeem all' checkbox.
Can I invest in SIP and Lump Sum of SBI Multicap Fund Direct Growth?
You can select either
SIP
or
Lumpsum
investment of SBI Multicap Fund Direct Growth based on
your investment objective and risk tolerance.
What is the NAV of SBI Multicap Fund Direct Growth?
The NAV of SBI Multicap Fund Direct Growth is ₹17.94 as of 14 Nov 2025.
What is the PE and PB ratio of SBI Multicap Fund Direct Growth?
The
PE ratio
ratio of SBI Multicap Fund Direct Growth is determined by dividing the market price by
its earnings per share and the
PB ratio
of the same is evaluated by dividing the stock price per share by its book value
per share (BVPS).

Index Constituent
Fund Overview
Investment Objective
The scheme will invest in stocks comprising the Nifty 50 index in the same proportion as their weightage in the index with the objective of achieving returns equivalent to the Total Returns Index of Nifty 50 index by minimizing the performance difference between the benchmark index and the scheme. The Total Returns Index is an index that reflects the returns on the index from index gain/loss plus dividend payments by the constituent stocks.
Mr. Raviprakash Sharma
Raviprakash Sharma has over 24 years of experience in Indian capital markets spanning across Equity and Fixed Income segments. Raviprakash joined SBI Funds Management Limited (SBIFM) in 2011 and currently is Head – Equity Dealing and Fund Manager. Prior to SBIFM, Raviprakash has been associated with HDFC Asset Management in the portfolio management services division. In his earlier assignments he has also worked with Citigroup Wealth Advisors India Pvt. Ltd. (as a Financial Advisor), Kotak Securities Ltd. (Non-Discretionary PMS) as well as with Birla Sun Life Securities Ltd. (Fixed Income Segment). Raviprakash is a Commerce graduate from Mumbai University and a Chartered Accountant from ICAI. He is also a Charterholder of the CFA Institute, USA.

Understand terms
Expense ratio
A fee payable to a mutual fund house for managing your mutual fund investments. It is the total percentage of a company’s fund assets used for administrative, management, advertising, and other expenses.
Tax
A percentage of your capital gains payable to the government upon exiting  your mutual fund investments. Taxation is categorized as long-term capital gains (LTCG) and short-term capital gains (STCG) depending on your holding period and the type of fund.
Exit load
A fee payable to a mutual fund house for exiting a fund (fully or partially) before the completion of a specified period from the date of investment.
Stamp duty
A form of tax payable for the purchase or sale of an asset or security.

FAQs
How to Invest in SBI Nifty Midcap 150 Index Fund Direct Growth?
You can easily invest in SBI Nifty Midcap 150 Index Fund Direct Growth in a hassle-free manner on Groww. The
process is extremely simple, quick and completely paperless. Invest in a few minutes with the following steps:
Log on to your Groww account
Search for SBI Nifty Midcap 150 Index Fund Direct Growth from the search box
In order to invest, you will have to complete all the KYC formalities which are completely online and paperless
and take a few minutes to complete
Once you are done with that, you can start investing in SBI Nifty Midcap 150 Index Fund Direct Growth as SIP or lumpsum as per your
investment objective and risk tolerance
What kind of returns does SBI Nifty Midcap 150 Index Fund Direct Growth provide?
The SBI Nifty Midcap 150 Index Fund Direct Growth has been there from 03 Oct 2022 and the average annual returns provided by this fund is 11.21% since its inception.
How much expense ratio is charged by SBI Nifty Midcap 150 Index Fund Direct Growth?
The term
Expense Ratio
used for SBI Nifty Midcap 150 Index Fund Direct Growth or any other mutual fund is the annual
charges one needs to pay to the Mutual Fund company for managing your investments in that fund.
The Expense Ratio of SBI Nifty Midcap 150 Index Fund Direct Growth is 0.40% as of 17 Nov 2025...
What is the AUM of SBI Nifty Midcap 150 Index Fund Direct Growth?
The AUM, short for
Assets Under Management
of SBI Nifty Midcap 150 Index Fund Direct Growth is ₹927.51Cr as of 17 Nov 2025.
How to Redeem SBI Nifty Midcap 150 Index Fund Direct Growth?
If you want to sell your SBI Nifty Midcap 150 Index Fund Direct Growth holdings, go to your holding on the app or
web and simply click on it. You will get two options - redeem & invest more; click on redeem and enter your
desired amount or if you wish to redeem the entire holding amount then select the 'redeem all' checkbox.
Can I invest in SIP and Lump Sum of SBI Nifty Midcap 150 Index Fund Direct Growth?
You can select either
SIP
or
Lumpsum
investment of SBI Nifty Midcap 150 Index Fund Direct Growth based on
your investment objective and risk tolerance.
What is the NAV of SBI Nifty Midcap 150 Index Fund Direct Growth?
The NAV of SBI Nifty Midcap 150 Index Fund Direct Growth is ₹19.42 as of 14 Nov 2025.
What is the PE and PB ratio of SBI Nifty Midcap 150 Index Fund Direct Growth?
The
PE ratio
ratio of SBI Nifty Midcap 150 Index Fund Direct Growth is determined by dividing the market price by
its earnings per share and the
PB ratio
of the same is evaluated by dividing the stock price per share by its book value
per share (BVPS).

Fund Data
Fund Overview
SBI Small Cap Fund aims to provide investors with opportunities for long-term growth in capital by investing predominantly in a well-diversified basket of equity stocks of small cap companies.
The fund predominantly invests (minimum 65%) in small cap stocks.
SBI Small Cap Fund can also take up to 35% exposure in other equities (including large and mid-cap companies) and/or debt and money market instruments.
The fund follows a blend of growth and value style of investing and will follow bottom-up investment strategy for stock selection.
Mr. R Srinivasan -
R Srinivasan has over 30 years’ rich experience in the financial services space. He has been associated with SBI Funds Management Limited since 2009 and as CIO – Equity directly manages a number of funds. He was formerly the Head of Equity. Srinivasan is a postgraduate in Commerce and has done his MFM from the University of Mumbai.

What is the AUM of SBI Small Cap Fund?
AUM of SBI Small Cap Fund is 36932.72 Cr.
What is the Riskometer level of SBI Small Cap Fund?
SBI Small Cap Fund is rated as a VERY HIGH. Benchmark Riskometer for this fund is S&P BSE Small Cap Index.
What are the top holdings of SBI Small Cap Fund?
Top Holdings for the fund as per percentage of amount invested is as follows:
> CASH, CASH EQUIVALENTS AND OTHERS : 4.14 %
> ATHER ENERGY LTD. : 3.76 %
> SBFC FINANCE LTD. : 2.76 %
> E.I.D-PARRY (INDIA) LTD. : 2.71 %
> KALPATARU PROJECTS INTERNATIONAL LTD. : 2.69 %
> CITY UNION BANK LTD. : 2.58 %
Is there any lock-in period for SBI Small Cap Fund?
No lock-in period is applicable for this fund.
What is the expense ratio of SBI Small Cap Fund?
Expense ratio for Regular scheme is 1.56% as on 31 Oct 2025 and Expense Ratio for Direct Scheme is 0.75% as on 31 Oct 2025
How can I redeem my investments in SBI Small Cap Fund?
> Login to your account.
> In the Dashboard, go to the Portfolio Snapshot section and click on Transact > Redeem.
> Enter the Amount/Units you wish to redeem.
> An OTP will be sent to your registered email ID/mobile number.
> After OTP verification, your redemption will be processed in 3 business working days.
What are the top sectors SBI Small Cap Fund has invested in?
Sector Allocations for as per percentage of amount invested is as follows:
> FINANCIAL SERVICES : 13.64 %
> CAPITAL GOODS : 10.67 %
> CONSUMER DURABLES : 10.37 %
> DERIVATIVES : 9.35 %
> FAST MOVING CONSUMER GOODS : 8.9 %
> CONSUMER SERVICES : 8.22 %
Who manages the SBI Small Cap Fund?
The Fund manager for this fund is:
> Mr. R Srinivasan since November 2013
What is the minimum investment in SBI Small Cap Fund?
Minimum Lumpsum Amount applicable for this fund is Rs. 5000 in multiples of 1.
Minimum Additional Lumpsum Amount applicable for this fund is Rs. 1000 in multiples of 1.
Minimum SIP Amount applicable for fund is Rs. 500

Understand terms
Expense ratio
A fee payable to a mutual fund house for managing your mutual fund investments. It is the total percentage of a company’s fund assets used for administrative, management, advertising, and other expenses.
Tax
A percentage of your capital gains payable to the government upon exiting  your mutual fund investments. Taxation is categorized as long-term capital gains (LTCG) and short-term capital gains (STCG) depending on your holding period and the type of fund.
Exit load
A fee payable to a mutual fund house for exiting a fund (fully or partially) before the completion of a specified period from the date of investment.
Stamp duty
A form of tax payable for the purchase or sale of an asset or security.

FAQs
How to Invest in SBI Nifty Smallcap 250 Index Fund Direct Growth?
You can easily invest in SBI Nifty Smallcap 250 Index Fund Direct Growth in a hassle-free manner on Groww. The
process is extremely simple, quick and completely paperless. Invest in a few minutes with the following steps:
Log on to your Groww account
Search for SBI Nifty Smallcap 250 Index Fund Direct Growth from the search box
In order to invest, you will have to complete all the KYC formalities which are completely online and paperless
and take a few minutes to complete
Once you are done with that, you can start investing in SBI Nifty Smallcap 250 Index Fund Direct Growth as SIP or lumpsum as per your
investment objective and risk tolerance
What kind of returns does SBI Nifty Smallcap 250 Index Fund Direct Growth provide?
The SBI Nifty Smallcap 250 Index Fund Direct Growth has been there from 03 Oct 2022 and the average annual returns provided by this fund is 1.73% since its inception.
How much expense ratio is charged by SBI Nifty Smallcap 250 Index Fund Direct Growth?
The term
Expense Ratio
used for SBI Nifty Smallcap 250 Index Fund Direct Growth or any other mutual fund is the annual
charges one needs to pay to the Mutual Fund company for managing your investments in that fund.
The Expense Ratio of SBI Nifty Smallcap 250 Index Fund Direct Growth is 0.40% as of 17 Nov 2025...
What is the AUM of SBI Nifty Smallcap 250 Index Fund Direct Growth?
The AUM, short for
Assets Under Management
of SBI Nifty Smallcap 250 Index Fund Direct Growth is ₹1,551.49Cr as of 17 Nov 2025.
How to Redeem SBI Nifty Smallcap 250 Index Fund Direct Growth?
If you want to sell your SBI Nifty Smallcap 250 Index Fund Direct Growth holdings, go to your holding on the app or
web and simply click on it. You will get two options - redeem & invest more; click on redeem and enter your
desired amount or if you wish to redeem the entire holding amount then select the 'redeem all' checkbox.
Can I invest in SIP and Lump Sum of SBI Nifty Smallcap 250 Index Fund Direct Growth?
You can select either
SIP
or
Lumpsum
investment of SBI Nifty Smallcap 250 Index Fund Direct Growth based on
your investment objective and risk tolerance.
What is the NAV of SBI Nifty Smallcap 250 Index Fund Direct Growth?
The NAV of SBI Nifty Smallcap 250 Index Fund Direct Growth is ₹18.63 as of 14 Nov 2025.
What is the PE and PB ratio of SBI Nifty Smallcap 250 Index Fund Direct Growth?
The
PE ratio
ratio of SBI Nifty Smallcap 250 Index Fund Direct Growth is determined by dividing the market price by
its earnings per share and the
PB ratio
of the same is evaluated by dividing the stock price per share by its book value
per share (BVPS).

Fund Data
Fund Overview
SBI Equity Hybrid Fund aims to provide investors with opportunities for long-term capital appreciation with liquidity of an open-ended scheme by investing in a mix of debt and equity.
The fund invests in a diversified portfolio of stocks of high growth companies and balance the risk through investing the rest in fixed income securities.
SBI Equity Hybrid Fund invests minimum of 65% in equity and equity related instruments.
At any point of time, the fund will allocate assets in the range of 20-35% towards debt and money market instruments.
Mr. R Srinivasan -
R Srinivasan has over 30 years’ rich experience in the financial services space. He has been associated with SBI Funds Management Limited since 2009 and as CIO – Equity directly manages a number of funds. He was formerly the Head of Equity. Srinivasan is a postgraduate in Commerce and has done his MFM from the University of Mumbai.
...
See More
Managing this fund since
Jan 2012
More Funds
managed by
Mr. R Srinivasan
Mr. Rajeev Radhakrishnan -
Rajeev Radhakrishnan has over 22 years experience in the Asset Management industry with around 20 years experience in fixed income funds management and dealing. Rajeev joined SBI Funds Management Limited (SBIFML) in 2008 as a Fixed Income Fund manager and later became Head - Fixed Income. He is currently CIO - Fixed Income and directly manages many of our flagship funds. Over this extensive experience in the asset management industry, he has managed Fixed Income products across liquid, money markets, hybrid, and active duration across various credit and interest rate cycles. Rajeev has also successfully led the mandate for unwinding the illiquid credit portfolio of a major fund house based on the mandate assigned by the Honourable Supreme Court and SEBI.Prior to joining SBIFML, Rajeev was associated with UTI Asset Management for seven years as co-Fund Manager, Fixed Income. During this initial tenure in UTIMF, Rajeev has had experience in equity and sectoral research for a brief period of 18 months, where he was associated with the unwinding of the US 64 portfolio, before shifting to Fixed Income dealing and subsequently to Fixed Income research and portfolio management.Rajeev is an Engineering graduate and holds a Master's degree in Finance from Mumbai University. He is also a Charter holder of the CFA Institute, USA. Rajeev is currently a member of the IRDAI consultative committee on Investments. He is also a Board member of the Indian Association of Investment Professionals (CFA India Society) & a member of the AMFI valuation committee. With a keen interest in identifying macroeconomic trends, Rajeev is also a periodic contributor to various external publications and media debates with respect to Fixed Income market trends.

Mansi holds bachelor's degree in Financial & Investment analysis from Delhi University and has completed post graduation diploma in Business Management from MDI, Gurgaon. FAQ Section
How to Invest in SBI Equity Hybrid Fund?
> Log in to the website.
> Choose between Lumpsum or Systematic Investment Plan (SIP).
> Choose your bank and preferred payment method.
> An OTP will be sent to your registered email ID and mobile number.
> Your transaction will be processed after OTP verification.
What is the current NAV of SBI Equity Hybrid Fund?
Latest closing NAV as on 14 Nov, 2025 for SBI Equity Hybrid Fund - Regular Plan - Growth is Rs. 311.8731
What is the AUM of SBI Equity Hybrid Fund?
AUM of SBI Equity Hybrid Fund is 81965.33 Cr.
What is the Riskometer level of SBI Equity Hybrid Fund?
SBI Equity Hybrid Fund is rated as a VERY HIGH. Benchmark Riskometer for this fund is CRISIL Hybrid 35 + 65 – Aggressive Index.
What are the top holdings of SBI Equity Hybrid Fund?
Top Holdings for the fund as per percentage of amount invested is as follows:
> GOVERNMENT OF INDIA : 8.53 %
> HDFC BANK LTD. : 5.3 %
> CASH, CASH EQUIVALENTS AND OTHERS : 4.58 %
> BHARTI AIRTEL LTD. : 3.99 %
> STATE BANK OF INDIA : 3.77 %
> KOTAK MAHINDRA BANK LTD. : 3.59 %
Is there any lock-in period for SBI Equity Hybrid Fund?
No lock-in period is applicable for this fund.
What is the expense ratio of SBI Equity Hybrid Fund?
Expense ratio for Regular scheme is 1.38% as on 31 Oct 2025 and Expense Ratio for Direct Scheme is 0.72% as on 31 Oct 2025
How can I redeem my investments in SBI Equity Hybrid Fund?
> Login to your account.
> In the Dashboard, go to the Portfolio Snapshot section and click on Transact > Redeem.
> Enter the Amount/Units you wish to redeem.
> An OTP will be sent to your registered email ID/mobile number.
> After OTP verification, your redemption will be processed in 3 business working days.
What are the top sectors SBI Equity Hybrid Fund has invested in?
Sector Allocations for as per percentage of amount invested is as follows:
> FINANCIAL SERVICES : 28.83 %
> SOVEREIGN : 8.53 %
> POWER : 8.52 %
> SERVICES : 8.08 %
> CONSUMER SERVICES : 4.79 %
> CASH, CASH EQUIVALENTS AND OTHERS# : 4.58 %
Who manages the SBI Equity Hybrid Fund?
The Fund managers for this fund are:
> Mr. R Srinivasan since January 2012
> Mr. Rajeev Radhakrishnan since November 2023
> Ms. Mansi Sajeja since December 2023
What is the minimum investment in SBI Equity Hybrid Fund?
Minimum Lumpsum Amount applicable for this fund is Rs. 1000 in multiples of 1.
